data.text:
On the cover: Stockton Asparagus Festival

* WHEN: 10 a.m.-7 p.m. today through

Sunday

* WHERE: Oak Grove Regional Park,

Interstate 5 and Eight Mile Road

* ADMISSION: $8; $5 (teens, seniors;

free (children

* PARKING: $3

* SHUTTLE BUS: Runs 9 a.m.-7 p.m.

Saturday and Sunday. Shuttle leaves Delta College's Shima parking lot, where

there is free parking, to the festival's main entrance. Trolley shuttles run

from 11 a.m.-4 p.m. between overflow parking and the Shima lot. Last shuttle

from the festival will leave at 7 p.m. each day. Cost is $3.

* INFORMATION: 547-2770 or www.asparagusfest.com

* BACKGROUND -- Eighteen years ago,

the founders of the Stockton Asparagus Festival sat down and wondered who would

show up for an event that celebrates asparagus. They soon found out, as 20,000

people turned out.

The festival has since emerged as

a Northern California favorite, drawing approximately 80,000 people per year.

It's organized and executed by volunteers who perform duties ranging from beverage

sales to pet-sitting, food preparation to child care, stage setup to security.

Proceeds are shared by area charities,

based on the number of hours its volunteers put in. In 2002, the Asparagus Festival

was able to distribute more than $206,000 among the dozens of charities involved.

Over the past 17 years, nearly $2.4 million has been contributed.

* PERSPECTIVE: In addition to asparagus

prepared every conceivable way, this weekend's festivities feature three stages

of music, wine and beer pavilion nearly 100 food and crafts vendors, children's

activities in the AsparaZone, the Got Milk? Gravity Tour, celebrity chefs, cooking

demonstrations, a classic car show, farmers market, Skyy Dog, the Tech Zone,

the Home and Garden Pavilion, and an asparagus-tossing competition.

* STARSHIP FEATURING MICKEY THOMAS

-- Thomas made his mark in 1976 as lead singer on the Elvin Bishop hit "Fooled

Around and Fell in Love." He later joined Starship and led the band through

its hit-making heyday, his vocals powering the singles "Jane," "No Way Out,"

"We Built This City" and "Sara." These days, Thomas tours with a reconstituted

Starship featuring Jeff Adams and Mark Abrahamian (guitars, Phil Bennett (keyboards

and Darrell Verdusco (drums.

* NEWSONG -- This Christian group,

known for such songs as "Arise, My Love," "Miracles," and "Jesus to the World

(Roaring Lambs," has scored 17 No. — singles and six Dove Award nominations.

Formed at Morningside Baptist Church in Valdosta, Ga., NewSong's lineup features

Eddie Carswell, Billy Goodwin, Michael O'Brien, Steve Reischl and Matt Butler.

* ROSE ROYCE -- This Grammy-winning

RB group made a name for itself with its debut album, the soundtrack to

the movie "Car Wash." The album sold more than a million copies and kicked off

a career that has included the hits "Love Don't Live Here Anymore," "Do Your

Dance," "I'm In Love," "I Wanna Get Next to You" and "Wishing on a Star." Rose

Royce features Kenny Copeland (vocals, trumpet, Richie Benson (vocals, Freddie

Dunn (trumpet, Walter McKinney (guitar, Mike Moore (saxophone and Henry Garner

(drums.

* DOUBLE FUNK CRUNCH -- This Bay

Area group specializes in reviving the high spirits of '70s funk through costumes,

skits and a repertoire of the era's best tunes.

* DADDY-O -- Since its inception

in 1970, this group has been combining comedy and dance with a repertoire of

favorite tunes from the 1950s and '60s.

Main Stage
